about.item:
About SciELO
SciELO Model SciELO - a model for cooperative electronic publishing in developing countries
The access to adequate and up-to-date scientific and technical information is essential for the economic and social development, specially to support decision making process in planning, formulation and implementation of public policies and to support professional development and practice. The results of scientific research are mainly communicated and validated through publication in scientific journals. This is valid for developed and developing countries. However, scientific journals from developing countries face several distribution and dissemination barriers, which limits the access and usage of locally generated scientific information.
SciELO - Scientific Electronic Library Online is a model for cooperative electronic publishing of scientific journals on the Internet. Especially conceived to meet the scientific communication needs of developing countries, particularly Latin America and the Caribbean countries, it provides an efficient way to assure universal visibility and accessibility to their scientific literature, contributing to overcome the phenomena known as 'lost science'. In addition, the SciELO model comprises integrated procedures for the measurement of usage and impact of scientific journals.
SciELO Model is product of a partnership among FAPESP (http://www.fapesp.br)– the State of São Paulo Science Foundation, BIREME (http://www.bireme.br) - the Latin America and Caribbean Center on Health Sciences Information, as well as national and international institutions related to scientific communication and editors. A pilot project, involving 10 Brazilian journals from different subject areas, was successfully carried out from March 1997 to May 1998, aimed at the development and evaluation of an adequate methodology for electronic publishing on the Internet. From June 1998, the project begins to operate regularly, incorporating progressively new journal titles and expanding its operation to other countries. Since 2002, the Project is also supported by CNPq (http://www.cnpq.br) - Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico.
The SciELO Model comprises three components.
The model's first component is the SciELO Methodology, which enables the electronic publication of complete editions of scientific journals, the organization of searchable bibliographical and full text databases, the preservation of electronic archives and the production of statistical indicators of the scientific literature usage and impact. The methodology includes also journal evaluation criteria based on international scientific communication standards. SciELO full texts are enriched with dynamic hypertext links with national and international data bases, as for example, LILACS and MEDLINE.
The SciELO Model's second component is the application of the SciELO Methodology to operate web sites of collections of electronic journals. The SciELO Model envisages the operation of national sites as well as thematic sites. The pioneer application is the SciELO Brazil site ( http://www.scielo.br). Nowadays, Chile (http://www.scielo.cl) and Cuba (http://www.scielo.sld.cu) are also operating applications regularly. Several other countries are evaluating and/or being trained on the SciELO Methodology. SciELO Public Health ( http://www.scielosp.org ), a regional thematic library covering Public Health scientific journals from Latin America and Spain, was launched in December 1999. A portal to integrate and provide access to the network of SciELO sites operates at http://www.scielo.org .
The Model's third component is the actual development of partnerships among national and international scientific communication players — authors, editors, scientific and technological institutions, funding agencies, universities, libraries, scientific and technological information centers etc, aiming at the dissemination, improvement and sustainability of the SciELO Model. The operation of the SciELO network is highly based on national infrastructures, which contributes to guarantee its future sustainability.
The successful development of the proposed SciELO network of Latin America and Caribbean scientific journals in the next years will contribute to make locally generated scientific information readily available, which will ultimately contribute to increase the usage of scientific and technical information on decision making process at different levels.
SciELO Criteria
SciELO Criteria: criteria, policy and procedures for admission and permanence of scientific journals in the SciELO collection
October 2004 Version
1 Introduction
This document describes the evaluation criteria adopted by the SciELO Project (http://www.scielo.org) for admission and permanence of scientific journals in the electronic collection.
These criteria, as well as the policy and procedures for governing their application, were discussed in the Seminar on the Evaluation and Selection Criteria for Scientific Journals, held in April 1999 at FAPESP - The State of São Paulo Research Foundation (http://www.fapesp.br), São Paulo, and later approved by FAPESP and BIREME - The Latin American and Caribbean Center on Health Sciences Information (http://www.bireme.br).
As the SciELO Project expands through Latin American countries, it is expected that such criteria will be progressively improved and generalized emerging to establish common criteria for admission and permanence of scientific journals in national and / or regional SciELO collections.
2 SciELO Criteria Objectives
SciELO Criteria are defined in the context of the SciELO Project, which is coordinated by FAPESP and BIREME, and also supported by CNPq - Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico (http://www.cnpq.br). The general goal of the SciELO Project is to contribute to the development of the national scientific research by improving and expanding its means of dissemination, publication, and evaluation through the intensive use of electronic publishing.
In the short term, the SciELO Project intends to radically increase the national and international visibility, accessibility and credibility of the Latin American and Caribbean scientific publication, through the integrated publishing of national and regional collections of scientific journals on the Internet. In the long term, the project envisions to increase the impact of the scientific literature from these regions.
In order to accomplish the SciELO Project objectives, it is essential the improvement of every aspect of the scientific communication in the country, seeking to identify, stimulate, and develop a core collection of scientific journals, in which the quality standards match international leading scientific journal standards. Therefore, the evaluation criteria for journals, as well as the policies and procedures for their application are a fundamental line of action for the SciELO Project.
Aiming at contributing to the creation and development of the SciELO core collection of scientific journals, the specific goals of the SciELO Criteria include:
providing data for the evaluation of national scientific journals in order to determine their admission to the SciELO collection;
monitoring the performance of the scientific journals included in the SciELO collection in order to determine their permanence in this collection;
producing performance indicators for the SciELO collection as a whole, and for each of its individual journals.
The SciELO Criteria contents and application will follow the SciELO Project dynamics and, specially, the process of creating and developing the SciELO core collection.
3 SciELO Consultancy Committee
Based on the SciELO Criteria, the Consultancy Committee will propose:
the inclusion of new scientific journal titles in the SciELO collection;
the exclusion of scientific journal titles from the SciELO collection;
changes in the evaluation criteria of scientific journals for admission to and permanence in the SciELO collection;
performance indicators for the journals belonging to the SciELO collection to be published regularly;
the definition and enhancement of the Committee's operation, this way enabling the efficient fulfilment of the above goals.
The Committee will be composed by representatives of the national scientific communication community.
4 SciELO Collection Scope
The SciELO collection includes scientific journals which predominantly publish the results of original scientific research, and other original works, which contribute significantly to knowledge in the area covered by the journal. Journals must carry out a peer review process for analysis and approval of submitted contributions.
Individual journal issues published by SciELO should start from 1997, or from its first issue in the case of journals founded after that year. Journal articles and other works can be published in the English, Portuguese or Spanish languages.
Journals published by the SciELO collection need not necessarily publish a printed version.
5 SciELO Criteria for journals admission
5.1 Criteria for automatic admission in the period 1999-2001
The SciELO Criteria for admission of new journals will take into consideration previous evaluations. Previous evaluations may have been conducted by governmental and scientific institutions, as well as a number of selected international indexes and databases.
A journal title will be automatically qualified for admission if it is indexed or abstracted in one of the selected indexes or databases mentioned below, or if it has reached a high performance in the evaluations conducted by governmental and scientific institutions.
5.1.1 Journals included in international indexes and databases
Journals which are indexed or abstracted by one of the following international indexes and databases are automatically qualified for initial admission into the SciELO collection:
- ISI
- MEDLINE/Index Medicus
- PsycInfo (APA)
The Consultancy Committee had sole responsibility for any changes in this list of sources.
The permanence in the SciELO collection of the journals included in such sources will be determined by performance indicators as stated in item 6.
5.2 Evaluation criteria for journals admission to the SciELO collection
When a journal title is not automatically qualified for admission to the SciELO collection, it will be evaluated accordingly to the following indicators:
5.2.1 Scientific content
Journals must predominantly publish the results of original scientific research, and other original works, which contribute significantly to knowledge in the area covered by the journal. When needed, the SciELO Consultancy Committee will request the judgement of peers to confirm the predominance of original contributions.
5.2.2 Peer review
Evaluation and approval of submitted contributions must be performed by peers. The journal editor should expressly specify the peer review process it applies for the approval of contributions. Once a journal is admitted to the SciELO collection the peer review process should be documented. The indication of the main dates of the process, including receipt and acceptance dates of a contribution will be mandatory.
5.2.3 Editorial board
The constitution of a journal's editorial board must be public. Its members should be renowned specialists from the country and abroad. Journal will not be admitted if the editorial board members are all from a specific institution, and which most of the articles come from a particular institution or geographical region, will not be admitted.
5.2.4 Frequency
Frequency is an indicator which depends on the journal subject area. Frequency indicates the scientific literature flow of a specific area covered by a journal. It is also an indicator related to the communication opportunity and speed.
According to broad subject areas, the following table points out the minimum and the desirable frequency, as well as the minimum and the desirable number of articles per year a journal is expected to present:
Area
Frequency
Number of articles per year
minimum
desirable
minimum
desirable
Agricultural and Exact Sciences three times a year quarterly
18
40
Life Sciences quarterly quarterly
32
60
Social Sciences and Humanities biannual three times a year
10
24
5.2.5 Lifetime
To be considered for evaluation, a journal must have published at least four issues.
5.2.6 Timeliness of publication
A journal must be publishing on time according to its stated frequency.
5.2.7 Article titles, abstracts, and keywords in English
Journal articles must provide English translations of titles, abstracts, and keywords, in the case English is not the original language of the article.
5.2.8 Standardization
The journal must specify which standards it follows for editorial presentation of periodicals and articles, as well as for document presentation, including bibliographical references, etc. SciELO will note whether or not the journal follows stated standards.
5.2.9 Authors affiliation
The papers must inform about authors affiliation, including place and institution of origin.
5.3 Admission process report
Admission of a journal to the SciELO collection must be carried out only after a favourable report by the SciELO Consultancy Committee. When needed, the Committee will request the judgement of peers to support its decisions.
SciELO National Unit will contribute to the Committee's work providing all needed information and documentation. Only those journals following the recommendations of itens 5.2.1. to 5.2.9 will be analised by the Consultancy Committee.
The Committee's report may include recommendations for journal improvements and changes, which should be followed within the period stated by the same report.
6 Performance evaluation criteria for journals permanence in the SciELO collection
All indicators applied in the admission process of journal titles to the SciELO collection will also be applied to evaluate their permanence in the collection. Fulfillment of the Committee's recommendations for journal improvements should be considered as an additional indicator of the journal’s permanence in the collection.
The following indicators are associated with a journal performance within SciELO collection, and will be used to justify its permanence in such a collection:
6.1 Timeliness of electronic file delivering to SciELO Unit
Timeliness of files containing journal articles and other works of delivery is measured by an issue's file arrival at the SciELO Unit. File delivering should rigorously follow the stated frequency of a journal. SciELO Unit will report any delay in file delivering.
Journals that appear chronically late will be evaluated by the SciELO Consultancy Committee, and will be subject to exclusion from the SciELO collection.
6.2 Journal usage
Journal usage is measured monthly by the number of times it is accessed, or viewed online. When a journal usage is consistently low and / or tends to decrease when compared to other journals of the same discipline, its permanence in the collection will be evaluated by the SciELO Consultancy Committee. The Committee will then suggest a study to find out the reasons and feasible solutions for such a poor usage, or recommend the journal [for] exclusion from the SciELO collection.
6.3 Impact factor
The frequency with which a journal has been cited in a certain year is based on citation analysis. The impact factor of a specific journal will be considered in relation to the impact factor of other journals within similar fields.
Increases of the impact factor or the maintenance of the same average of related journals will be considered a productive performance, which assures the permanence of a journal in the SciELO collection.
7 Exclusion process report
Exclusion of a journal from the SciELO collection will be carried out only after a decision has been reported by the SciELO Consultancy Committee.
8 Judgement appeals
Journal editors have the right to appeal against judgements of the SciELO Consultancy Committee at any time, in relation to both admission and exclusion processes. Appeals will be analysed by the Committee, which may evaluate a journal once more. The Committee's report will be sent to the editor.
9 Readmission process
Excluded journals from the SciELO collection can be readmitted, provided that they fulfil all admission and permanence criteria of SciELO. Readmissions will be analysed by the SciELO Consultancy Committee. Readmission of a journal will not be carried out immediately after it has been excluded from the SciELO collection. A journal will be re-evaluated only if it is able to fulfil all criteria for at least four consecutive issues or one year.
Certification criteria for SciELO sites
Certification criteria for SciELO sites: criteria, policy and procedures to classify and certify sites from the SciELO Network
Version March 2008
1 Introduction
This document aims to describe the criteria, policies and procedures adopted to evaluate and certificate SciELO Sites, available at the network Portal (http://www.scielo.org), and to define the characteristics of the regular operation Sites, under development Sites and pilot Sites.
The Scientific Electronic Library Online - SciELO - is a model for cooperative electronic publishing of scientific journals on the Internet, specially created for developing countries.
The SciELO Model enables managing electronic scientific journal collections and comprises 3 components: SciELO Methodology, SciELO Site and SciELO Network.
Applying the SciELO Model enables managing the electronic scientific journal network, through the organization of bibliographical and full text databases, the storing and preservation of electronic archives.
Among the resources provided by the SciELO Model, besides the publication of full texts, we can highlight the production of statistical indicators of the scientific literature usage and impact, the operation of dynamic hypertext links and the bibliographical record exchange with national and international databases. SciELO also enables publishing support materials, such as graphics and colored images, audio and video.
It is worth mentioning that SciELO Methodology may be applied to operate any individual journal or any scientific journal collection. However, creating a collection recognized as a SciELO Site demands not only the use of SciELO Methodology, but also requires that the titles be selected according to previously defined quality criteria for SciELO Network sites.
The journal collections that do not meet the SciELO quality criteria may be operated on the Internet through SciELO Methodology; however, in this case, they will not be recognized as a SciELO Site.
For more information on the adoption of SciELO Methodology, refer to the documents 'Guide for the Installation of SciELO Sites' (http://www.scielo.org /php/level.php?lang=en&component=42&item=5 ) and 'Training Workshop on SciELO Methodology' (http://www.scielo.org /php/level.php?lang=en&component=42&item=6 ).
2 SciELO Site
SciELO Methodology is the first component of SciELO Model and includes policies, rules, guidelines, procedures and tools related to electronic publishing, as well as evaluation and selection of journals, besides preparing, marking, storing, publishing, preserving, and also hyperlinks to other sources of information, use control and impact of the scientific journals operated on SciELO Sites.
Applying the methodology consists of dealing with scientific journal texts through five modules, as shown on the figure below:
The second component of the Model is the SciELO Site, which operates nationwide electronic journal collections or thematic decentralized collections, selected according to previously established criteria. The third component is the SciELO Network, which integrates individual SciELO Sites available at http://www.scielo.org.
The methodology is applied to create and operate collections of electronic scientific journals, organized according to geographic and/or thematic objectives. The selected collections that operate on the Internet under the methodology are SciELO Sites.
SciELO Sites are classified as:
a. Regular operation site:
Sites available at the SciELO Network Portal (http://www.scielo.org), under section 'Journals by Collection', and meet the site evaluation and certification criteria, as described bellow:
1. National Institution responsible for coordinating and operating the SciELO Site, acting as Executive Secretariat;
2. Scope of the collection, defined and published on the site;
3. National SciELO Advisory Committee, established and under operation;
4. Journal selection criteria, defined and published on the site;
5. Minimum of four titles available, with at least the last two years of publication;
6. Defined URL, preferably with the structure http://www.scielo.siglasdopais;
7. Results of the journal selection published on the site;
8. Site operational quality proven from the SciELO Network Site Evaluation Guide;
9. Operation of scientific journal collection according to SciELO Methodology at local server;
10. SciELO's Web Services installed, set up and in regular operation; and
11. Metadata Exporting procedures installed to allow indexing and retrieval on SciELO Portal.
The national sites in regular operation must meet the criteria of this document within one year.
b. Under development site:
Sites available at the SciELO Network Portal (http://www.scielo.org), under section 'Initiatives under development', which are in a periodic monitoring phase for future certification as regular operation sites.
The operation is monitored by a partnership developed between SciELO Operational Coordination (BIREME/PAHO/WHO) and the team responsible for the operational development of the National or thematic SciELO Site.
These sites feature:
1. National Institution responsible for coordinating and operating the SciELO Site, acting as Executive Secretariat;
2. Scope of the collection, defined and published on the site;
3. National SciELO Advisory Committee, established and under operation;
4. Journal selection criteria, defined and published on the site;
5. Minimum of four titles available, with at least the last two years of publication; and
6. Defined URL, preferably with the structure http://www.scielo.sigladopais.
The difference between regular operation sites and under development sites consists on meeting the criteria defined on items 7, 8 and 9 of this document.
c. Pilot Site:
Sites that intend to integrate SciELO Network Brazil and are under implementation.
They are characterized by:
1. National Institution responsible for coordinating and operating the SciELO Site, acting as Executive Secretariat; and
2. Scope of the collection, defined and published on the site.
The pilot sites will be classified as under development sites after meeting the criteria defined on items 3, 4, 5 and 6 of this document.
3 Evaluation and certification criteria of sites from SciELO Network
The evaluation and certification criteria of SciELO Sites were established aiming to:
a. subsidize the SciELO Network site classification process into: regular operation sites, under development and pilot sites; and
b. to generate performance indicators of the sites included in the SciELO Network.
The criteria defined below are applicable to SciELO Sites operating under SciELO Methodology and are available at http://www.scielo.org.
3.1 Selection and evaluation criteria for scientific journals
The selection and evaluation criteria for composing and maintaining national scientific journal collections will be defined according to the 'SciELO Criteria: criteria, policy and procedures for admission and permanence of scientific journals in the SciELO collection', available at http://www.scielo.org/php/index.php?lang=en , which may be adapted to each country reality, regarding the following items:
a. criteria for automatic admission journal in the collection; and
b. periodicity and number of articles per year.
3.2 National SciELO Advisory Committee
The application of the SciELO Methodology in a SciELO Site requires the existence of a National Advisory Committee. Based on the application of journal selection criteria, it will have the following attributions:
a. to include new scientific journal titles in the SciELO collection;
b. to exclude scientific journal titles from the SciELO collection;
c. to adjust the evaluation criteria of scientific journals for admission to and permanence in the SciELO collection, on the following items: 1) criteria for automatic admission journal in the collectio, 2) periodicity and number of articles per year;
d. to define performance indicators for the journals belonging to the SciELO collection to be published regularly;
e. to define and improve the Committee's operation in order to efficiently achieve the above mentioned goals; and
f. To discuss and propose policies, programs, procedures and activities aiming to strengthen the collection.
The Advisory Committee will be composed of up to four representatives of national science and technology institutions and communities directly related to national scientific communications, together with up to four editors of the national or thematic journals of SciELO Sites, who are elected by all the collection editors. The institutions and editors will be permanently represented. The national Institution responsible for coordinating and operating the SciELO Site is responsible for the Presidency of the National SciELO Advisory Committee.
For multidisciplinary sites, it is recommended to have representatives from the thematic areas, such as: Agricultural Sciences, Biological Sciences, Exact Sciences and Human Sciences, indicating the respective deputy representatives.
The policies for creating and maintaining electronic scientific journal collections in SciELO Sites will be defined by the respective national committees and will be published on the site pages.
3.3 National scientific journal collection scope
To make up the national electronic scientific journal sites, it is necessary to define the collection scope, based on specifications of the covered thematic area(s).
Moreover, the collections belonging to the SciELO Sites will necessarily consist of scientific journals that predominantly publish articles resulting from original scientific research and other original significant contributions for the journal specific area. Peers must perform the review and approval process.
The collection of each individual title at the SciELO Site must begin with its approval by the National Advisory Committee, and it is recommended to include the retrospective issues up to 1997, or as from the first issue for journals created after 1997. The texts may be written in English, Portuguese, Spanish, French, or any combination of these languages.
3.4 Site operational quality
The SciELO Site operational quality is checked by compliance with the following items:
a. to obey the journal selection and evaluation criteria;
b. to regularly update the site, including periodicity of the journals in o the collection;
c. to correctly operate the interface, with integrity of the links and recovery;
d. to keep the site available uninterruptedly;
e. to provide the site with reasonable mean speed for access; and
f. to include a minimum of four titles available, with at least the last two years of publication.
For more details, refer to the items specified at the 'SciELO Network Site Evaluation Guide'.
DTD SciELO version 3.1
® download documentation in PDF format
Introduction The DTD module is composed by a set of DTDs (Document Type Definition), in compliance with ISO 8879-1986 (SGML - Standard Generalized Markup Language) and ISO 12083-1994 (Electronic Manuscript Preparation and Markup) regulations. SGML is the metalanguage used for the description of complete texts, and based on this language, DTDs used by FAPESP/BIREME Electronic Journal Project were defined. Each DTD indicates the elements, either mandatory or not, belonging to a document and to the element content structure, together with the values of the attributes used.
Number structure of eletronic journals (version 3.0)
DTD-SciELO Serial
<!ENTITY % art SYSTEM 'art3_0.dtd'>
%art;
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Serial -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT serial - - (serfront, serbody, serback?) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Front Matter -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT serfront - - (cover, title, stitle?, altitle?, isstitle, edname,
serpubfr?, ssponsor, toct?) >
<!ATTLIST serfront
count CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT artwork - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT altitle - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT edname - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT ssponsor - - (artwork, %m.org;) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Serial Publisher's Front Matter -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT serpubfr - - (date | status | issueid | issn | volid | pubid)* >
<!ELEMENT status - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT issueid - - (issueno, issuept?, supplid?, iseqno?) >
<!ELEMENT issuept - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT supplid - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT iseqno - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT pubid - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Table of Contents -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT toct - - (header, secgrp, bibstrip) >
<!ELEMENT header - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST header
language CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT secgrp - - (sectitle, entrygrp) >
<!ELEMENT sectitle - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST sectitle
seccode CDATA #IMPLIED
language CDATA #IMPLIED >
<!ELEMENT entrygrp - - (entry*) >
<!ELEMENT entry - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT bibstrip - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST bibstrip
language CDATA #IMPLIED >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Body -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT serbody - - (sersec+) >
<!ELEMENT sersec - - (title+, article+, text*) >
<!ELEMENT text - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Back Matter -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT serback - - (ack, vita, glossary) >
<!ELEMENT ack - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT vita - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT glossary - - (#PCDATA) >
Description of DTD-SciELO Serial structure
The number [serial] element of the DTD-SciELO Serial 3.0 version has three main elements: serial front matter [serfront], serial body matter [serbody] and serial back matter [serback]. The first two elements are mandatory and the third one is optional.
The serial front matter [serfront] element has [count] as amendatory attribute, indicating the number of articles that each journal issue. [serfront] has all the elements: cover [cover], which provides the image of the issue's cover and is composed of the element artwork [artwork], which brings indications for identifying the image used for viewing the cover; title of the journal [sertitle]; abbreviated title of the journal [stitle]; alternative title [altitle] for the journals with an official title, but which may also be known by another title, for instance, Brazilian Journal of Genetics, also known as Revista Brasileira de Genética; issue title [isstitle] identifying the titles of a specific issue, like 'Computer Graphics and Image Processing' in the Journal of the Brazilian Computer Society; editor's name [edname], used to identify the name of the editor of a specific issue. Moreover, [serfront] is also composed of the group of serial publisher's front matter [serpubfr], journal sponsor [sponsor] and table of contents model [toct].
The serial publisher's front matter [serpubfr] has the elements used to identify publication and editor. It comprises the elements date of publication of the issue [date] - which has the attribute data ISO [dateiso]; availability of access [status] to documents pertaining to a specific issue; the group providing information about the identification of the issue [issueid] (which contains the elements issue number [issueno], part of the issue [issuept], supplement to identifyion of the numbers [supplid] and sequential number of the issue [iseqno] ); number of the issue [ issueno]; part of the issue [issuept] for issues with more than one section; supplement of one issue [supplid]; and the sequential number of the issue [seqno], which indicates the sequence order of the issue in the current year; International Standard Serial Number [issn]; volume [volid]; and number of identification of the publication [pubid].
The financial element of the journal [sponsor] coveys the main information about those who finance a title. It comprehends the element artwork [artwork], with the image of the sponsor and the organization model [m.org], which has the elements organization name [orgname] and organization division [orgdiv].
The element table of contents model [toct] indicates the model to be used to prepare the summary of an issue. This element contains head of summary [header] with the title used for the summary, as 'summary' or 'table of contents' and the attribute language [language], indicating the language used for preparation of the summary; an information group on section [secgrp], composed of the elements title of section [title[DG1]], which has the attributes section code [seccode] and issue language [language] and the entry group [entrygrp] identifying the existing entries [entry] in the issue. Furthermore, within [toct] we find the element bibliographic strip [bipstrip] with the attribute language [language] to indicate in which language the strip is created.
The second element in the series [serial] is the serial body matter [serbody] comprising the elements issue section [sersec], composed of the elements title of section [title], article [article] and text [text]. The latter two are described in items 'Description of DTD-SciELO Article structure' (Item 4.2) and 'Description of DTD-SciELO Text structure' (Item 3.2).
The last element in the series [serial] is serial back matter [serback], composed of the elements with the following additional information: acknowledgements [ack], curriculum vitae [vita] and glossary [glosary].

<!-- Text -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ENTITY % common SYSTEM 'common31.dtd'>
%common;
<!ELEMENT text - - (titlegrp? & authgrp? & (#PCDATA)?) +(%i.float;) >
<!ATTLIST text
pii CDATA #REQUIRED
doctopic CDATA #REQUIRED
language CDATA #REQUIRED
ccode CDATA #REQUIRED
status CDATA #REQUIRED
version CDATA #REQUIRED
type NAMES #REQUIRED
order CDATA #REQUIRED
seccode CDATA #REQUIRED
sponsor CDATA #REQUIRED
stitle CDATA #REQUIRED
volid CDATA #IMPLIED
supplvol CDATA #IMPLIED
issueno CDATA #IMPLIED
supplno CDATA #IMPLIED
dateiso CDATA #REQUIRED
fpage CDATA #REQUIRED
lpage CDATA #REQUIRED
issn CDATA #REQUIRED
toccode CDATA #REQUIRED>
Description of DTD-SciELO Text structure
DTD-SciELO Text Version 3.1 defines the text structure of the electronic journals that do not have the characteristics of scientific article, such as an editorial or obituary. The texts marked with this DTD will be entered and retrieved from the database exactly like the scientific articles.
The element [text] has the following attributes to identify the text in the journal issue:
Publisher Item Identifier [pii], used to identify the items in a document (an individual number for an individual item). It is composed of a character to identify the publication type (S for journals and B for monographs); the publication's ISSN or ISBN; two digits indicating the year of publication, only for journals; five characters identifying the publication's item (this is a sequential and annual number); and a character for the verifying digit. For example: S0165-3806(96)00403-8, where S identifies that the item belongs to a serial publication, 0165-3806 is the ISSN, 96 is the year of publication, 00403 is the sequential number that identifies the item and 8 is the verifying digit. This attribute is mandatory.
Document Topic [doctopic], indicates the type of publication being marked, such as original article, editorial or literary review. It is mandatory to fill in this attribute.
Language [language], mandatory attribute indicating the language of the article.
Center code [ccode], indicates the code of the article's processing center, and is a mandatory attribute.
Status [status], indicates the access availability of the document. Filling in this attribute is mandatory.
Version [version], indicates the DTD-SciELO Article version that is used in the process of marking the article. Mandatory attribute.
Type [type], indicates the type of illustrations contained in the article. This attribute is mandatory.
Order [order], indicates the order in which the article appears on the table of contents in the issue. It is mandatory to fill in this attribute.
Section code [seccode], code identifying the journal section in which the article appears. This attribute is mandatory.
Sponsor [sponsor], identifies the institution financing the article or scientific research.
Shortened title [stitle], informs the shortened title of the journal with the article. Mandatory attribute.
Volume [volid], indicates the volume of the issue with the article. Filling in this attribute is mandatory.
Supplement volume [supplvol], indicates the issue of the supplement volume of a journal.
Issue number [issueno], indicates the number of the issue that contains the article. Mandatory attribute.
Supplement number [supplno], indicates the number of the supplement of a journal's issue.
Date ISO [dateiso], shows the standardized date of the issue containing the article. The ISO date is composed of four characters indicating the year, two characters indicating the month and two more indicating the day, i.e., March 1997, dateiso=19970300 (YYYYMMDD). For the publications that have two months, the last month should be identified in the ISO date, for instance, January/March 1997, dateiso=19970300. It is mandatory to fill in this attribute.
International Standard Serial Number [issn], has the ISSN number of the journal. In the case of electronic publications, it must display the ISSN of the journal's electronic format. Mandatory attribute.
Table of content code [toccode], indicates if the title that shall appear in the journal's table of content is the title of the text or of the section.
First page [fpage], indicates the initial page of the text or article in the printed version. Mandatory attribute.
Last page [lpage], indicates the last page of the text or article in the printed version. Mandatory attribute.
Example of mark on text [text]: [text pii=nd doctopic=le language=en ccode=br1.1 status=1 version=3.1 type=nd order=29 seccode=BJG080 stitle='Braz. J. Genet.' volid=20 issueno=3 dateiso=19970900 issn=0100-8455 toccode=2 fpage=102 lpage=106]
DTD-SciELO Text constitutes two groups of elements: a title group [titlegrp] and na author group [authgrp]. The [titlegrp] is composed of title model [m.title] - title [title] (with the attribute language [language]) and subtitle [subtitle].
Example of mark on title group [titlegrp]: [titlegrp] [title language=es] Determinantes del Voto Partidario en Sistemas Electorales Centrados en el Candidato [/title]: [subtitle]Evidencias sobre Brasil [/subtitle] [/titlegrp]
The [authgrp] comprises the elements individual author [author] and corporate author [corpauth]. The [author] (with the attributes occupation [role] and crossed identifier [rid]) is composed of the name model [m.name] - surname [surname] and first name [fname], whereas [corpauth] is composed of the organization model [m.org].
Example of mark on author group [authgrp]: [authgrp] [author role=nd rid='a01'] [fname]A.C. [/fname][surname]Almeida [/surname] [/author]1, [author role=nd rid='a02'] [fname]V.L.V. [/fname][surname]Abreu [/surname] [/author]2, [author role=nd rid='a03'] [fname]F.C.F. [/fname][surname]Lobato [/surname] [/author]3 [corpauth] [orgname]Universidade de São Paulo [/orgname], [orgdiv]Escola de Comunicações e Artes [/orgdiv] [corpauth] [/authgrp]
Apart from the two groups of elements, DTD-SciELO Text contains one last element that is the model [i.float] composed of floating elements. The elements pertaining to this model may be inserted in any level of the structure.
The first element on this model is affiliation [aff]. This element possesses the attributes identifier [id], organization name [orgname], organization division 1 [orgdiv1], organization division 2 [orgdiv2] and organization division 3 [orgdiv3], which are used to identify the institution divisions, starting with the largest division. It is also composed of the elements city [city]; state [state]; country [country]; zipcode [zipcode]; and e-mail [email].
Example of mark on affiliation [aff]: [aff id='a01' orgname='Universidade de Alfenas' orgdiv1='Instituto de Ciências Agrárias e Medicina Veterinária'] 1Instituto de Ciências Agrárias e Medicina Veterinária da Universidade de Alfenas. MG 179, km 0, Campus Universitário. [zipcode] 37130-000 [/zipcode] , [city] Alfenas [/city] , [state] MG [/state][/aff]
The second element in [i.float] is ignore [ign], indicating the text elements that do not have any bibliographic value. This element is automatically inserted by SGML Parser software.
The other elements are table [table] and figure group [figgrp]. The table [table] contains the attribute number [no] to identify the table's number in the text and it also contains the elements title model [m.title] and legend [legend]. The figure group [figgrp] has the attributes number [no] to identify the figure number in the text and encompasses the elements title model [m.title], figure reference [figref] and legend [legend].
Article structure of electronic journals (version 3.1)

<!ELEMENT back - - ((bbibcom, (vancouv | iso690 | abnt6023 | other)?,
bbibcom?) |
((vancouv | iso690 | abnt6023 | other), bbibcom?)) >

standard CDATA #REQUIRED
count CDATA #REQUIRED >

<!ELEMENT et-al - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT vtitle - - (%m.title;, tp?) >
<!ELEMENT tp - - (#PCDATA) >

<!-- Serial Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->

suppl | part | cited | extent | pages | url)*) >

<!ELEMENT stitle - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT inpress - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT volid - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT issueno - - (#PCDATA) >

<!ELEMENT pages - - (#PCDATA) >

version | confgrp | city | state | pubname |
inpress | date | pages | report | thesis)*) >
<!ELEMENT edition - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT version - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT pubname - - (#PCDATA) >

<!ELEMENT iso690 - - (%m.iso;) >
<!ATTLIST iso690
standard CDATA #REQUIRED
count CDATA #REQUIRED >

<!-- Contribution -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT icontrib - - (((author | corpauth)*, et-al?) & subresp* &
(%m.title;)? & section? & pages? & location? &
notes? & url? & isbn?) >
<!ELEMENT subresp - - (%m.name;) >
<!ATTLIST subresp
role CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT section - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT location - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Serial Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT iiserial - - (isstitle? & ((author | corpauth)*, et-al?) &
medium? & (stitle | sertitle)? & (edition | city |
state | country | pubname | date | update |
cited | location | volid | isdesig | issueno |
pages | notes | url | issn)*) >
<!ELEMENT isstitle - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT medium - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT notes - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT issn - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT isdesig - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Monographic Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT imonog - - (((author | corpauth)*, et-al?) & (%m.title;) &
medium? & ( edition | subresp | city | state |
country | pubname | date | update | cited | volid |
pages | extent | location | coltitle | notes |
url | isbn)*) >
<!ELEMENT coltitle - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT update - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ATTLIST update
dateiso CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT isbn - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- ABNT NBR6023/89 -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT abnt6023 - - (%m.abnt;) >
<!ATTLIST abnt6023
standard CDATA #REQUIRED
count CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT acitat - - (no?, (acontrib? & amonog? & aiserial? & confgrp?)) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Contribution -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT acontrib - - (((author | corpauth)*, et-al?) & (%m.title;) &
volid? & pages?) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Serial Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT aiserial - - ((sertitle | stitle)? & isstitle? & (city | state |
country | pubname | suppl | volid | issueno |
date | extent | pages | notes | issn)*) >
<!ELEMENT sertitle - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Monographic Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT amonog - - (((author | corpauth)*, et-al?) & (%m.title;) &
(subresp | edition | confgrp | city | state |
country | pubname | date | volid | tome | extent |
pages | coltitle | colvolid | notes |
isbn | thesis)*) >
<!ELEMENT tome - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT colvolid - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Other (DTD fbpe 1.1) -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT other - - (%m.other;) >
<!ATTLIST other
standard CDATA #REQUIRED
count CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT ocitat - - (no?, (ocontrib | omonog | oiserial | confgrp)*) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Contribution -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT ocontrib - - ((oauthor* & ocorpaut* & et-al?) & (%m.title;)? &
date? & pages?) >
<!ELEMENT oauthor - - ((%m.name;) | anonym | previous) >
<!ATTLIST oauthor
role NAMES #REQUIRED
rid IDREFS #IMPLIED >
<!ELEMENT ocorpaut - - ((%m.org;) | previous) >
<!ELEMENT previous - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT anonym - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Monographic Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT omonog - - (((oauthor | ocorpaut)*, et-al?) & ((%m.title;)? &
confgrp? & thesis? & date? & pages? & edition? &
city? & state? & country? & pubname? & extent? &
coltitle? & volid? & isbn? & othinfo?))+ >
<!ELEMENT othinfo - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Serial Level -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT oiserial - - ((sertitle | stitle)? & (isstitle? & othinfo? &
city? & country? & pubname? & volid? & issueno? &
suppl?& pages? & extent? & date? & issn?)+) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Thesis -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT thesis - - (%m.thes;) >
<!ELEMENT degree - - (#PCDATA) >
Description of DTD-SciELO Article structure
The DTD-SciELO Article version 3.1 is responsible for defining the language of description of electronic journal articles. This DTD was based mainly on standard ISO 12083 (Electronic Manuscript Preparation and Markup), on the bibliographic description model used by Bireme (Latin American and Caribbean Center on Health Sciences Information) and on the database LILACS (Latin American and Caribbean Literature on Health Sciences Information).
The element [article] comprises three groups similar to those in the element [serial] from DTD-SciELO Serial version 3.1: front matter [front], body matter [body] and back matter [back].
Furthermore, the [article] has practically all attributes of the element [text] from DTD-SciELO Text version 3.1, previously described:
Publisher Item Identifier [pii];
Type of document [doctopic];
Language [language];
Center code [ccode];
Status [status];
Version [version];
Type [type];
Order [order];
Section code [seccode];
Sponsor [sponsor];
Shortened title [stitle];
Volume [volid];
Sepplement volume [supplvol];
Issue number [issueno];
Supplement number [supplno];
Date ISO [dateiso];
International Standard Serial Number [issn];
First page [fpage];
Last page [lpage].
Example of mark on article [article]: [article pii=nd doctopic=oa language=en ccode=br1.1 status=1 version=3.1 type='fig tab' order=01 seccode=nd stitle='Rev. Inst. Med. Trop. Sao Paulo' volid=39 issueno=4 dateiso=19970700 issn=0036-4665 fpage=108 lpage=120]
The element front matter [front] of a journal article is composed of three large groups: title group [titlegrp], author group [authgrp] and complementary bibliographic element group [bibcom].
The title group [titlegrp], like title group [titlegrp] presented in DTD-SciELO Text version 3.1, comprises títle model [m.title], and has the elements title [title] and subtitle [subtitle].
The author group [authgrp] identifies the authors of the article marked. It is made of the elements: individual author [author] - which has the attributes occupation [role] indicating if the author is, for instance, an editor or an organizer and crossed identifier [rid], indicating the author's affiliation, followed by name model [m.name], with the elements surname [surname] and name [name]; and corporate author [corpauth] followed by organization model [m.org], with the elements organization name [orgname] and organization division [orgdiv].
Example of mark on author group [authgrp] used in [article]: [authgrp][author role=nd rid=a01][fname]Maria Fernanda C. [/fname][surname]CARVALHO[/surname] [/author] (1), [author role=nd rid=a02][fname]Marcello F. de [/fname][surname]FRANCO [/surname][/author](2) & [author role=nd rid=a01][fname]Vitor Augusto[/fname] [surname] SOARES [/surname][/author][/authgrp]
The last element of [front], the complementary bibliographic element group [bibcom], is made of the complementary bibliographic element model [m.bib].
This model encompasses the elements: abstract [abstract], keyword group [keygrp], conference group [confgrp], report [report], thesis group [thesgrp], article history [hist] and title model [m.title].
The first element, abstract [abstract] indicates the abstract of the article and has the attribute language [language] to identify the abstract's language. More than one abstract may be marked on the journals containing abstracts in more than one language.
Example of mark on abstract [abstract]: [abstract language=en] Trypanosoma cruzi , the causative agent of Chagas'disease assumes two distinct forms in vertebrate hosts: circulating trypomastigote and tissular amastigote. This latter form infects predominantly the myocardium, smooth and skeletal muscle, and central nervous system. The present work describes for the first time the detection of amastigote forms of T. cruzi in the renal parenchyma of a kidney graft recipient one month after transplantation. The patient was serologically negative for Chagas'disease and received no blood transfusion prior to transplant. The cadaver donor was from an endemic area for Chagas'disease. The recipient developed the acute form of the disease with detection of amastigote forms of T. cruzi in the renal allograft biopsy and circulating trypomastigote forms. The present report demonstrates that T. cruzi can infect the renal parenchyma. This mode of transmission warrants in endemic areas of Chagas'disease.[/abstract].
The element keyword group [keygrp] has the attributes controlled vocabulary [scheme] indicating if the keywords used to describe the article have been taken from any specific vocabulary such as the DeCS. This group is composed of the elements: keyword [keyword], which has the attributes type [type], to identify if the descriptor [DG2]is primary or secondary, language [language] and crossed identifier [rid], indicating if there is any type of subkey; subkey (subkey) with the attribute identifier [id] indicating the relation with the element [keyword]; and period covered [dperiod] indicating the time period dealt with in the article. This element has the attributes from [from] and to [to] pointing out the initial date and final period analyzed and shall be entered in the same format as the ISO date (YYYYMMDD).
Example of mark on keyword group [keygrp]: [keygrp scheme=nd] [keyword type=m language=en rid=k01]Chagas'disease[/keyword]- [subkey id=k01]symptoms[/subkey]; [keyword type=m language=en] Trypanosoma cruzi [/keyword]; [keyword type=m language=en]Kidney transplantation[/keyword]; [dperiod from=19930000 to=19970000]1993-1997[/dperiod] [/keygrp]
The third element, conference group [confgrp] is composed of conference model [m.conf] indicates if the work has been previously presented at congresses or conferences, and contains the elements necessary to identify these events.
The conference model [m.conf] has the elements: sponsor [sponsor], indicating who has financed the event and is composed of organization model [m.org]; conference name [confname]; conference number [no]; date [date] indicating the first day of the event - it has the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; city [city], where the event took place; state [state] where the event was held; and country [country] where the event was held.
Example of mark on conference group [confgrp]: [confgrp]Presented in part at [no]X[/no] [confname]International Conference on AIDS/STD[/confname], [city]Yokohama[/city], [country]Japan[/country], [date dateiso=19940806]6-11 August, 1994[/date].[/confgrp]
The element report [report] of the complementary bibliographic element model [m.bib] is composed of the report model [m.rep]. This element is used to indicate if the text is a product of a project or of a technical report and provides information needed to identify this document.
The report model [m.rep] comprises the elements project sponsor [rsponsor] and project name [projname]. The element [rsponsor] has the elements organization model [m.org] and contract number [contract] used to identify the project.
Example of mark on report [report]: [report]Supported in part by [rsponsor][orgname] FAPESP[/orgname]#[contract]90/4798-3[/contract][/rsponsor], [rsponsor][orgname]Ministry of Health of Brazil[/orgname], [orgdiv]Coordenação Nacional de DST e AIDS [/orgdiv] #[contract] 038/94[/contract][/rsponsor], and [rsponsor][orgname]NIH Fogarty International AIDS Training Grant[/orgname] #[contract]D43-TW00003[/contract][/rsponsor][/report]
The fifth element of the [m.bib] is thesis group [thesgrp] made of thesis model [m.thes]. This group of elements indicates if the article is a product of a dissertation or thesis, and provides information necessary to identify this document.
The thesis model [m.thes] is composed of the elements city [city]; state [state]; country [country] - these three elements provide information on location of the institution where the dissertation or thesis was presented; the viva date [date], with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; and degree [degree] of the product - whether it was a Master's Degree dissertation, a Ph.D. or Post-doctorate thesis; and by organization model [m.org] to identify the institution and its unit.
Example of mark on thesis group [thesgrp]: [thesgrp][city]Washington[/city], [state]DC[/state], [date dateiso=19670000]1967[/date]. Diss. ( [degree]mestr.[/degree] ) - [orgname]Catholic University of America[/orgname], [orgdiv]Dept. of Library Science[/orgdiv][/thesgrp]
The next element of the complementary bibliographic information model [m.bib] is history [hist], with the main dates of the article publication process in a journal issue. This element comprises the elements receipt date [received], with the attribute date ISO [dateiso] indicating the date when the article was submitted to analysis; date of approval [accepted], with the attribute date ISO [dateiso] indicating the date when the article was accepted for publishing; and review date [revised] with the attribute date ISO [dateiso] - indicating the dates the article was revised.
Example of mark on history [hist]: [hist]Recebido para publicação em [received dateiso=19970429] 29/04/1997 [/received]. Revisto em [revised dateiso=19960526] 26/05/1997 [/revised]. Aceito para publicação em [accepted dateiso=19970725] 25/07/1997 [/accepted] [/hist]
The last element of the complementary bibliographic information model [m.bib] is title model [m.title].
The second element of the article [article] is the body matter [body]. This element is the main text of the articles. In this methodology version, in addition to receiving the mark HTML (Hyper Text Markup Language) responsible for the text's presentation and availability in the Web, the element may also receive the mark of the elements present in the floating element model [i.float] previously described.
The last element of the [article] is the back matter [back]. This element is responsible for identifying the other complementary bibliographic elements and also the elements belonging to bibliographic references, which are the bases to evaluation studies of the national scientific production. The [back] comprises five elements: back complementary bibliographic element group [bbibcom], bibliographic list in Vancouver format [vancouv], bibliographic list in ISO 690/87 format [iso690], bibliographic list in ABNT 6023/89 format [abnt6023] and bibliographic list [other] in formats that do not comply with the previous standards.
The first element of the [back], back complementary bibliographic element group [bbibcom] is composed of the complementary bibliographic element model [m.bib], previously described.
The four last elements of the [back] are exclusive: if a bibliographic list format is adopted, no other format can be used.
The first bibliographic list is the bibliographic list in Vancouver format [vancouv]. The element [vancouv] complies with the Vancouver model [m.van] and contains the attributes standard [standard] indicating the standard used and reference number [count] indicating the number of references in the article.
The vancouver model [m.van] consists of the element citation in vancouver format [vcitat] identifying each reference in the bibliographic list. This element is made of number [no] identifying the number of the bibliographic references; contribution in vancouver format [vcontrib]; serial publication in vancouver format [viserial]; and monograph in vancouver format [vmonog].
The elements [vcontrib], [viserial] and [vmonog] are elements that could be combined in order to mark a bibliographic reference. The element contribution in vancouver format [vcontrib] is used to identify the part from the whole set. A journal article is a part of a journal, therefore, its reference is marked with the elements [vcontrib] and [viserial]. A chapter of a book is part of a monograph so that it should be marked with the elements [vcontrib] and [vmonog]. A complete monograph shall be marked only with the element [vmonog]. To use these three elements, it is important to clarify what is the part and what is the whole set.
The element contribution in vancouver format [vcontrib] comprises the elements individual author [author], with the previously described attributes [role] and [rid], composed of name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth] made of organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al] indicating the reference includes authors who are not described; and the element title in vancouver format [vtitle], composed of title model [m.title] and by identification of publication type [tp].
The second element is the serial publication in vancouver format [viserial] and is composed of the elements: shortened title in vancouver format [vstitle], which is made of the elements shortened title [stitle] and publication type [tp]; in press [inpress] indicates the document is still in the press; date [date] indicates the publishing date and has the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; cited in [cited] points out when the document was last accessed in the Web - it also has the attributes date ISO [dateiso]; volume [volid]; issue number [issueno]; supplement number [suppl]; part number [part] for issues that are divided into parts; pages [pages] indicating the first and last pages of an article; extent [extent] indicating the total number of pages; and the last element, electronic direction [url] indicating location of the journal in the Web.
The last element of [vcitat] is the monograph in vancouver format [vmonog], which provides information about the monograph. The elements comprising [vmonog] are: author [author] - with the attributes [role] and [rid] - composed of the name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth] made of organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al] indicating that some authors are not mentioned; title in vancouver format [vtitle], composed of title model [m.title] and publication type [tp]; number of edition [edition] of the publication; version [version] of the publication - used for electronic documents; conference group [confgrp] made of conference model [m.conf]; city [city]; state [state] - the latter two indicate the physical location of the monograph publishing house; name of publisher or publishing house [pubname]; in press [inpress]; date [date] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; first and last pages of the publication [pages]; report [report] in compliance with the project model [m.rep]; and the last element thesis [thesis] according to thesis model [m.thesis]. The last two elements indicate if the monograph is a thesis or a project report and if it contains the elements necessary to identify such information.
Example of mark on citation in vancouver format [vcitat]:
Journal Article:
Browell DA, Lennard TW. Immunologic status of the cancer patient and the effects of blood transfusion on antitumor responses. Curr Opin Gen Surg 1993:325-33
[vcitat][vcontrib][author role=nd][surname]Browell [/surname][fname]DA[/fname][/author], [author role=nd][surname]Lennard [/surname][fname]TW[/fname][/author]. [vtitle][title language=en]Immunologic status of the cancer patient and the effects of blood transfusion on antitumor responses [/title] [/vtitle] [/vcontrib]. La segunda lista bibliográfica es la lista bibliográfica en el formato ISO 690/87 [iso690]. El elemento [iso690] sigue el modelo ISO 690/87 [m.iso] y contiene los atributos norma [standard] que indica la norma utilizada y número de referencias [count] que indica el número de referencias bibliográficas del artículo.
The ISO 690/87 model [m.iso] consists of the element citation in ISO 690/87 format [icitat] identifying each reference in the bibliographic list. This element is made of number [no] identifying the number of bibliographic references; contribution in ISO 690/87 format [icontrib]; serial publication in ISO 690/87 format [iiserial]; and monograph in ISO 690/87 format [imonog].
The elements [icontrib], [iiserial] and [imonog], as well as [vcontrib], [viserial] and [vmonog] in the Vancouver format, are elements that might be combined to mark a bibliographic reference.
The element contribution in ISO 690/87 format [icontrib] comprises the elements: individual author [author] - with the attributes [role] and [rid] previously described - composed of name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth], composed of organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al] identifying that the reference includes authors not mentioned; secondary responsibility [subresp] identifies people with secondary responsibilities, such as translators and proofreaders and complies with name model [m.name] - it also has the attribute role [role]; title model [m.title]; section [section] indicating the contribution section; first and last pages [pages] of the contribution; location [location] to identify the location on the electronic format; notes [notes]; electronic direction [url]; and International Standard Book Number [isbn].
The second element is the serial publication in ISO 690/87 format [iiserial] and is composed of the elements: number title [isstitle]; individual author [author] - with the attributes [role] and [rid] previously described - composed of the name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth], comprising organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al] identifying that the reference includes authors not mentioned; medium format [medium] in which the document is being edited; shortened title [stitle] of the magazinejournal and serial publication title [sertitle] (one of the two has to be used); edition number [edition] of the publication; city [city]; state [state]; country [country] - these three last elements indicate the place where the magazinejournal was published; name of publisher or publishing house [pubname]; number designation [isdesig] providing complementary information about the magazinejournal publishing dates; date [date] of the publication, with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; update date [update] of the publication, with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; citation date [cited] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; location [location] indicating the location of a part of the document in the electronic format; volume [volid]; issue number [issueno]; pages [pages] indicating the first and last pages of an article; notes [notes]; electronic direction [url] and the element International Standard Serial Number [issn].
The last element of [icitat] is monograph in ISO 690/87 format [imonog], which provides information on the monograph. It comprises the elements [imonog] author [author] - with the attributes [role] and [rid], composed of name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth] composed of organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al], indicating that some authors are not mentioned; title model [m.title]; medium format [medium] in which the document is edited; number of the publication edition [edition]; secondary responsibility [subresp] identifying those who have secondary responsibilities, such as translators and proofreaders, in compliance with name model [m.name] - with the attribute role [role]; city [city]; state [state]; country [country] - the last three elements indicate the physical location of the monograph publishing house; name of publisher or publishing house [pubname]; date [date] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; update date [update] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; citation date [cited] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; volume [volid]; first and last pages [pages] of the publication; extent [extent] indicating the total number of pages; location [location] within the electronic document ; collection title [coltitle]; notes [notes]; electronic direction [url]; and International Standard Book Number [isbn].
Example of mark on citation in ISO 690/87 format [icitat]:
Journal article:
LARSON, Julian R. and TANNEHILL, Robert S. Problems in accessing scientific and technical serials. Special Libraries. July/Aug. 1977, vol. 68, no. 7/8, p. 241-251

Photography by [subresp role=ot] [fname]Robert Emmett [/fname] [surname]Bright[/surname] [/subresp][/icontrib]. La tercera lista bibliográfica es la lista bibliográfica en el formato ABNT 6023/89 [abnt6023]. El elemento [abnt6023] sigue el modelo ABNT 6023/89 [m.abnt] y contiene los atributos norma [standard] que indica la norma utilizada y número de referencias [count] que indica el número de referencias bibliográficas del artículo.
The ABNT 6023/89 model [m.abnt] is composed of the element citation in ABNT 6023/89 format [acitat] identifying each reference of the bibliographic list. This element is composed of: number [no] identifying the numbers of the bibliographic references; contribution in ABNT 6023/89 format [acontrib]; monograph in ABNT 6023/89 format [amonog]; serial publication in ABNT 6023/89 format [aiserial]; and conference group [confgrp].
The elements [acontrib], [aiserial], [amonog] and [confgrp], as well as the elements [vcontrib], [viserial] and [vmonog] in the Vancouver format, are elements that may be combined to mark a bibliographic reference.
The element contribution in ABNT 6023/89 format [acontrib] comprises the elements: : individual author [author] - with the attributes [role] and [rid] previously described - composed of name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth], composed of organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al] identifying that the reference has other authors not mentioned; title model [m.title]; volume [volid]; and pages [pages].
The second element in [acitat] is the monograph in ABNT 6023/89 format [amonog] providing information about the monograph. Its elements [amonog] are: author [author] - with attributes [role] and [rid] - composed of the name model [m.name]; corporate author [corpauth] composed of organization model [m.org]; and others [et-al] indicating that some authors are referred; title model [m.title]; secondary responsibility [subresp] identifying those who have secondary responsibilities, such as translators and proofreaders and complies with name model [m.name] - it also has the attribute role [role]; edition number [edition] of the publication; conference group [confgrp] with information on the conference where the paper was presented - this group complies with the conference model [m.conf] and shall be used to mark annals or proceedings that have been printed; city [city]; state [state]; country [country] - these three last ones indicate the physical location of the monograph publishing house; name of the publisher or publishing house [pubname]; date [date] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; volume [volid]; tome [tome] for works that are divided; extent [extent] indicating the total number of pages; first and last pages [pages] of the publication; collection title [coltitle]; collection volume [colvolid]; notes [notes]; International Standard Book Number [isbn]; and thesis [thesis] composed of the thesis model [m.thes].
The third element is serial publication in ABNT 6023/89 format [aiserial] and is composed of the elements: serial publication title [sertitle] and shortened title [stitle] of the magazinejournal (one or the other must be used); issue title [isstitle]; city [city]; state [state]; country [country] - these three last elements indicate the place where the magazinejournal was published; name of publisher or publishing house [pubname]; supplement number [suppl]; volume [volid]; issue number [issueno]; date [date] indicating the date of the publication - it has the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; extent [extent] indicating the total number of pages; initial and last pages [pages] of an article; notes [notes]; and the element International Standard Serial Number [issn].
The last element is the conference group [confgrp] composed of the conference model [m.conf]. This [confgrp] is used to mark the bibliographic reference of works that have already been presented in congresses or events, but have not been published yet.

The forth element, bibliographic list [other] does not comply with any of the reference standards previously mentioned. The element [other] complies with other model [m.other] and contains the attributes standard [standard] indicating the standard used, and number of references [count] indicating the number of bibliographic references in the article.
The other model [m.other] is composed of the element citation in other format [ocitat] identifying each reference in the bibliographic list. This element comprises: number [no], identifying the number of the bibliographic references; contribution in other format [ocontrib]; monograph in other format [omonog]; serial publication in other format [oiserial]; and conference group [confgrp].
The elements [ocontrib], [oiserial], [omonog] and [confgrp], as well as the elements [vcontrib], [viserial] and [vmonog] in the Vancouver format, are elements that may be combined to mark a bibliographic reference.
The element contribution in other format [ocontrib] comprises the elements: individual author in other format [oauthor] - with the attributes [role] and [rid] previously described - composed of name model [m.name], by the indication of anonym authorship [anonym] and previous author [previous] indicating that the author mentioned in the reference is the same of the previous reference; corporate author in other format [ocorpaut] made of organization model [m.org] and previous author [previous], indicating that the author mentioned in the reference is the same of the previous reference; and others [et-al] identifying that the reference includes authors not mentioned; title model [m.title]; date [date] identifying the publication date - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; and pages [pages].
The second element of [ocitat] is the monograph in other format [omonog] providing information about the monograph. It comprises the elements [omonog]: individual author in other format [oauthor] - with the attributes [role] and [rid] previously described - which is composed of name model [m.name], indication of anonym authorship [anonym] and previous author [previous] indicating that the author mentioned in the reference is the same of the previous reference; corporate author in other format [ocorpaut] composed of organization model [m.org] and previous author [previous], indicating that the author mentioned in the reference is the same of the previous reference; and others [et-al] indicating that some authors are not mentioned; title model [m.title]; conference group [confgrp] with information on the conference where the paper was presented - this group complies with the conference model [m.conf] and shall be used to mark annals or proceedings that have been printed; thesis [thesis] composed of thesis model [m.thes]; date [date] of the publication - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; pages [pages] first and last page of an article; edition number [edition] of the publication; city [city]; state [state]; country [country] - these three last elements indicate the location of the monograph publishing house; name of publisher or publishing house [pubname]; extent [extent] indicating the total number of pages; collection title [coltitle]; volume [volid]; International Standard Book Number [isbn]; and other information [othinfo].
The third element is serial publication in other format [oiserial] encompassing the elements serial publication title [sertitle] and shortened title [stitle] of the magazinejournal (one or the other must be used); issue title [isstitle]; other information [othinfo]; city [city]; country [country] - these two last elements indicate the place where the magazinejournal was published; name of publisher or publishing house [pubname]; volume [volid]; issue number [issueno]; supplement number [suppl]; pages [pages] indicating the first and last page of an article; date [date] indicating the publication date - with the attribute date ISO [dateiso]; extent [extent] indicating the total number of pages; and the element International Standard Serial Number [issn].
The last element is the conference group [confgrp] composed of conference model [m.conf]. This [confgrp] is used to mark the reference of works that have been presented in congresses or events, but have not been published.
The last element in [article] is model [i.float] made of floating elements. The elements pertaining to this model may be inserted in any level of the structure and have been previously described. (Fig. 6)

Appendix 1 - Common elements of DTDs Article and Text
Common elements of DTDs Article and Text
<!-- alteracao em 23/02/2000 -->
<!-- devido a filiacao, que passou a ter orgdiv1, orgdiv2 e orgdiv3 como atributo, e ter eliminado orgdiv -->
<!-- ========================================================== -->
<!-- Common Elements (ARTICLE 3.1, TEXT 3.1) -->
<!-- ========================================================== -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Common Models -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ENTITY % i.float 'aff | ign | table | figgrp' >
<!ENTITY % m.name '(fname? & surname)' >
<!ENTITY % m.org '(orgname? & orgdiv?)' >
<!ENTITY % m.title 'title, subtitle?' >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Floating Elements -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT ign - - CDATA >
<!ELEMENT aff - - (city? & state? & country? & zipcode? & email? & (#PCDATA)?)>
<!ATTLIST aff
id ID #REQUIRED
orgname CDATA #REQUIRED
orgdiv1 CDATA #IMPLIED
orgdiv2 CDATA #IMPLIED
orgdiv3 CDATA #IMPLIED >
<!ELEMENT zipcode - - (#PCDATA)>
<!ELEMENT email - - (#PCDATA)>
<!ELEMENT city - - (#PCDATA)>
<!ELEMENT state - - (#PCDATA)>
<!ELEMENT country - - (#PCDATA)>
<!ELEMENT table - - ((%m.title;)? & legend?) >
<!ATTLIST table
no CDATA #REQUIRED>
<!ELEMENT legend - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT figgrp - - ((%m.title;)? & figref? & legend?) >
<!ATTLIST figgrp
no CDATA #REQUIRED>
<!ELEMENT figref - - (#PCDATA) >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Title Group -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT titlegrp - - (%m.title;)+ >
<!ELEMENT title - - CDATA >
<!ATTLIST title
language CDATA #REQUIRED >
<!ELEMENT subtitle - - CDATA >
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!-- Author Group -->
<!-- ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ -->
<!ELEMENT authgrp - - (author | corpauth)+ >
<!ELEMENT author - - (%m.name;) >
<!ATTLIST author
role NAMES #REQUIRED
rid IDREFS #IMPLIED>
<!ELEMENT corpauth - - (%m.org;) >
<!ELEMENT fname - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT surname - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT orgname - - (#PCDATA) >
<!ELEMENT orgdiv - - (#PCDATA) >
